match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: India won by 6 wickets (with 27 balls remaining)
match.hoursInfo: 13.00 start, First Session 13.00-16.30, Interval 16.30-17.15, Second Session 17.15-20.45

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Pandya b Kumar 120 (112b 11x4 2x6 183m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: holes out to long-off. High-ish full toss outside off. Looks to clobber it over extra cover again but that's tough to control when he has to reach out so much. Pandya settles under it and completes the catch. World class innings from Faf

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris b Kuldeep Yadav 37 (43b 4x4 1x6 60m) SR: 86.04

dismissalComment.html: oh he should be fined half his IPL contract for that shot. Morris has looked completely assured, but he's completely missed this. It's a full toss on off stump, prime for a flogging anywhere in front of the stumps. But he's made a decision early to sweep. He's also through the shot much before the ball arrives. It all looks very ugly in the end, as the ball lands on the crease, spins in and tonks off stump. That looked a bit like someone was learning video game controls

headshotImage.caption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: doesn't pick the googly and that makes it all the more special for Kuldeep. He pitches the ball a shade short, on and around off stump - step one of the plan. Step two depends on the batsman. If he spots the variation, he would play with a straight bat. Duminy doesn't. He thinks he can cut it away for runs. And the moment, he gets in position for that, he's in danger. Making things worse for him is that the ball skids through fairly low and knocks middle back middle stump

Kohli claims the catch and now it's over to the umpires. Ian Gould's soft signal is out. Lets see. Replays show conclusively that he's right. Good effort from the Indian captain, diving forward and scooping the ball up just as it dies on him. But the better one was from Kuldeep, in the way he drew Miller forward, forcing him to play away from the body. Beautiful work from the wristspinner, bowling slow and backing himself to beat his opponents in the air

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: oh he should be fined half his IPL contract for that shot. Morris has looked completely assured, but he's completely missed this. headshotImage.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: this looks good for India! Yes, it's given! Chahal pushes one flat at a leg stump line. It's pitching in line too. He looks to flick but he misses. Little doubt in this as it appears. De Kock won't even discuss a review. DRS however shows the ball would be spinning past leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at midwicket! Good work from Pandya, running to his left to intercept a pretty hard-hit flick. Markram would have expected a lot of runs for that shot, having charged down the pitch and picking up the ball on the half-volley. As it turns out, however, he's forced to walk back.

headshotImage.caption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla lbw b Bumrah 16 (17b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: given lbw! Amla has missed one that's angled in. Full ball, angled in at off stump. Oh hang on, this could be a no-ball...nope, he gets the benefit of doubt. Very very close from Bumrah. Unlike the lbw decision, he's plumb there. Beaten by pace more than anything, late on the attempted drive

dismissalText.commentary: Kagiso Rabada run out (†Dhoni/Kumar) 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: slower ball pushed wide and he can't get bat on it. But he does manage to get Andile on strike. Dhoni picks up and throws to the bowler who is ready at the non-striker's end to flick the bails off

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Rabada b Phehlukwayo 112 (119b 10x4 0x6 164m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: yet another slower bouncer. Yet another hoick under it. This time Rabada comes under it and snaps it up. Unlike Kohli to keep going after that, but Phehlukwayo's persistence has been rewarded. Nevertheless, it's a standing ovation for Kohli for yet another stunning second-innings knock

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c Imran Tahir b Phehlukwayo 79 (86b 5x4 2x6 126m) SR: 91.86

dismissalComment.html: lobs one for long-on. Length ball follows him down leg side. He goes for a pick-up over midwicket, but that gets too big on him. He ends up lifting a simple one for Tahir. A stunning knock from Rahane, if he ever needed one.

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: lobs one for long-on. Length ball follows him down leg side. He goes for a pick-up over midwicket, but that gets too big on him. He ends up lifting a simple one for Tahir. A stunning knock from Rahane, if he ever needed one.

yet another slower bouncer. Yet another hoick under it. This time Rabada comes under it and snaps it up. Unlike Kohli to keep going after that, but Phehlukwayo's persistence has been rewarded. Nevertheless, it's a standing ovation for Kohli for yet another stunning second-innings knock

taken by de Kock. An ugly hoick from Rohit. Length ball at off stump is always going to to rise when it's Morkel bowling. Rohit goes across the line and it sits in the pitch slightly. Enough bounce for him to get a top edge that will land in the gully region. Everyone makes way as the keeper calls loudly and takes an easy one

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c †de Kock b Morkel 20 (30b 2x4 1x6 25m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: taken by de Kock. An ugly hoick from Rohit. Length ball at off stump is always going to to rise when it's Morkel bowling. Rohit goes across the line and it sits in the pitch slightly. Enough bounce for him to get a top edge that will land in the gully region. Everyone makes way as the keeper calls loudly and takes an easy one

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan run out (Markram) 35 (29b 6x4 0x6 53m) SR: 120.68

dismissalComment.html: inside edge saves Dhawan from the lbw but Markram has lit the stumps up at the other end to run him out! Dhawan is unhappy with his partner. He's six yards short. He was looking to flick this behind square with the angle and narrowly escaped being caught right in front of middle stump because of an inside edge. In the mean time, Kohli tried to steal a single as the ball rolled pitch side into the off side. Two people in the game are still alive to the possibilities at this point - Kohli at the non-strikers end and Markram at point. Dhawan isn't ready for this run but Kohli is already halfway down. In the frenzy of the noise and the visuals, he decides to run because he doesn't seem to have a choice. Markram picks up with one hand and finishes the throw perfectly

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c Imran Tahir b Phehlukwayo 79 (86b 5x4 2x6 126m) SR: 91.86

headshotImage.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: there's the win. Short ball in at middle stump. Watches it come on and shovels it through square leg with a short-arm action

commentPostTextItems.html: 8:55pm And that is all from our presentation for you today. We hope you enjoyed the wonderful cricket we were treated to today, and hope you'll join us as we call the second game for you in a few days. Good night!

Virat Kohli: Yeah it was quite special. First match of the series is important. We wanted to take the momentum of the Test win into this and when we restricted South Africa to 270 on this sort of a pitch, we were happy. Very happy for Jinx. Jinx is a top class player. We understood fast bowling was going to be a big factor in this tour. He was superb, he took on the fast bowlers. [On India's bowling] Bhuvi and Bumrah, we bank on them. Picking up one or two wickets in the top ten is what we wanted to do. And then the two wristpsinners - outstanding bowling by both of them. They are working wonderfully for the team. They're playing in South Africa for the first time. They were very brave, they were throwing it up and that's why they got wickets. As a captain, its outstanding when you have two guys who know what they want to do.
Virat Kohli is the Man of the Match.

Faf du Plessis: Just a few battle scars. Just went upstairs to get the fingers checked. One-day cricket the intensity is a lot higher. Happy to ge through the game. Feeling strong. Definitely didn't get enough, we didn't bat well enough. I reckon we were about 50-60-70 runs short. Chris had a good partnership but as a batting unit we were disappointed. When you're chasing five runs an over here, it's pretty easy. Tried everything with field placesments and tactics but Virat and Rahane played very well.

Mileend: "Kohli-Rahane partnership gives memories of Sachin-Dravid's many match winning and building partnerships, just think if Rahane gets a longer run in ODI he can be next Dravid, hes adaptive enough to be like him"

Deepak Karkala: "How accurate was Kuldeep in his assessment of the score during the Innings break? "269 is a good score. Hopefully we can chase in 45-46 overs". This is what he said!!"

8:35pm A canter for India in the end. A six-wicket win with nearly five overs to spare. South Africa's 17-game winning streak at home has ended. It wasn't a "complete performance" from India by any means, but enough players contributed at the right moments to seize this game from South Africa, who had the momentum at the start of the match. The miserly wristspin duo took five wickets between them, conceding under four per over when the medium-pacers endured a bad day. Then, Kohli and Rahane in partnership - they put on 189 - were masterful as they dismantled South Africa with strategic running before bringing out the big shots. Nicely finished in the end for India, and they now have a 1-0 lead.

commentTextItems.html: full toss on off stump. Defended down the pitch
good length outside off, tapped into the covers off the front foot
close shout for lbw is turned down. It's a full ball and he's locked himself as he looks to flick. It strikes him on the pads and it would have gone down

commentTextItems.html: full outside off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
good length and in at leg stump. Misses on the flick again. Deflected in fine leg's region and they pinch a second

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Rabada b Phehlukwayo 112 (119b 10x4 0x6 164m) SR: 94.11

commentPostTextItems.html: And then there's an eruption because MS Dhoni has walked out

commentTextItems.html: full toss on leg stump. Looks to flick, misses. Appeal is turned down and it's being reviewed. Looks like that was going down but he was struck on the full so this will be interesting...replays confirm it was going down.
short ball down leg side, swivels and pulls to fine leg's left
good length on off stump, defended down the pitch

headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: looks like Shamsi has kicked the ball into play at fine leg. Kohli nails the hook and it's racing away to Shamsi's left at fine leg. Puts in a lunge and ends up volleying it to deep square leg. Wenger, sign him up!
the most radical opening shot you'll see. Walks across and shows middle and leg. Picks the full ball and flicks to fine leg
good length outside off, punches it to mid-off's right on the up but can't beat Amla's slide
back of a length outside off, punched to extra cover on the up
another bouncer. This one zooms past him. He's late on the hook

dropped. Zondo puts down a simple one after running in from deep square leg. Another slow bouncer from Andile. Kohli can't get above it once more. In fact, he gets too far under it. Hooks aerially and an easy one goes down in the deep

slower ball, back of a length on off stump. Flicked to midwicket on the up

headshotImage.caption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Kohli b Kuldeep Yadav 7 (7b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Kohli claims the catch and now it's over to the umpires. Ian Gould's soft signal is out. Lets see. Replays show conclusively that he's right. Good effort from the Indian captain, diving forward and scooping the ball up just as it dies on him. But the better one was from Kuldeep, in the way he drew Miller forward, forcing him to play away from the body. Beautiful work from the wristspinner, bowling slow and backing himself to beat his opponents in the air

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris b Kuldeep Yadav 37 (43b 4x4 1x6 60m) SR: 86.04

dismissalComment.html: oh he should be fined half his IPL contract for that shot. Morris has looked completely assured, but he's completely missed this. It's a full toss on off stump, prime for a flogging anywhere in front of the stumps. But he's made a decision early to sweep. He's also through the shot much before the ball arrives. It all looks very ugly in the end, as the ball lands on the crease, spins in and tonks off stump. That looked a bit like someone was learning video game controls

dismissalText.commentary: Kagiso Rabada run out (†Dhoni/Kumar) 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: slower ball pushed wide and he can't get bat on it. But he does manage to get Andile on strike. Dhoni picks up and throws to the bowler who is ready at the non-striker's end to flick the bails off

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel not out 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: holes out to long-off. High-ish full toss outside off. Looks to clobber it over extra cover again but that's tough to control when he has to reach out so much. Pandya settles under it and completes the catch. World class innings from Faf

headshotImage.caption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: given lbw! Amla has missed one that's angled in. Full ball, angled in at off stump. Oh hang on, this could be a no-ball...nope, he gets the benefit of doubt. Very very close from Bumrah. Unlike the lbw decision, he's plumb there. Beaten by pace more than anything, late on the attempted drive

headshotImage.caption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: this looks good for India! Yes, it's given! Chahal pushes one flat at a leg stump line. It's pitching in line too. He looks to flick but he misses. Little doubt in this as it appears. De Kock won't even discuss a review. DRS however shows the ball would be spinning past leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at midwicket! Good work from Pandya, running to his left to intercept a pretty hard-hit flick. Markram would have expected a lot of runs for that shot, having charged down the pitch and picking up the ball on the half-volley. As it turns out, however, he's forced to walk back.

headshotImage.caption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021

Step two depends on the batsman. If he spots the variation, he would play with a straight bat. Duminy doesn't. He thinks he can cut it away for runs. And the moment, he gets in position for that, he's in danger. Making things worse for him is that the ball skids through fairly low and knocks middle back middle stump

dismissalComment.html: oh he should be fined half his IPL contract for that shot. Morris has looked completely assured, but he's completely missed this. headshotImage.longCaption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Pandya b Kumar 120 (112b 11x4 2x6 183m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: holes out to long-off. High-ish full toss outside off. Looks to clobber it over extra cover again but that's tough to control when he has to reach out so much. Pandya settles under it and completes the catch. World class innings from Faf

headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kagiso Rabada run out (†Dhoni/Kumar) 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: slower ball pushed wide and he can't get bat on it. But he does manage to get Andile on strike. Dhoni picks up and throws to the bowler who is ready at the non-striker's end to flick the bails off

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c †de Kock b Morkel 20 (30b 2x4 1x6 25m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: taken by de Kock. An ugly hoick from Rohit. Length ball at off stump is always going to to rise when it's Morkel bowling. Rohit goes across the line and it sits in the pitch slightly. Enough bounce for him to get a top edge that will land in the gully region. Everyone makes way as the keeper calls loudly and takes an easy one

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan run out (Markram) 35 (29b 6x4 0x6 53m) SR: 120.68

dismissalComment.html: inside edge saves Dhawan from the lbw but Markram has lit the stumps up at the other end to run him out! Dhawan is unhappy with his partner. He's six yards short. He was looking to flick this behind square with the angle and narrowly escaped being caught right in front of middle stump because of an inside edge. In the mean time, Kohli tried to steal a single as the ball rolled pitch side into the off side. Two people in the game are still alive to the possibilities at this point - Kohli at the non-strikers end and Markram at point. Dhawan isn't ready for this run but Kohli is already halfway down. In the frenzy of the noise and the visuals, he decides to run because he doesn't seem to have a choice. Markram picks up with one hand and finishes the throw perfectly

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Rabada b Phehlukwayo 112 (119b 10x4 0x6 164m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: yet another slower bouncer. Yet another hoick under it. This time Rabada comes under it and snaps it up. Unlike Kohli to keep going after that, but Phehlukwayo's persistence has been rewarded. Nevertheless, it's a standing ovation for Kohli for yet another stunning second-innings knock

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c Imran Tahir b Phehlukwayo 79 (86b 5x4 2x6 126m) SR: 91.86

dismissalComment.html: lobs one for long-on. Length ball follows him down leg side. He goes for a pick-up over midwicket, but that gets too big on him. He ends up lifting a simple one for Tahir. A stunning knock from Rahane, if he ever needed one.

headshotImage.caption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hardik Pandya not out 3 (6b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 50

stories.title: We needed 300, unfair to blame bowlers - du Plessis
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: We needed 300, unfair to blame bowlers - du Plessis
stories.summary: South Africa captain Faf du Plessis said that while the pitch offered assistance for the spinners, South Africa's batsmen needed to adapt better and string together partnerships

image.caption: Faf du Plessis raises the bat on reaching his hundred
image.longCaption: Faf du Plessis raises the bat on reaching his hundred, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: India's wristspinners announce themselves in the land of the wrong'un
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Monga: India's wristspinners announce themselves in the land of the wrong'un
stories.summary: Marrying magic with temperament, control with flair, Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav stemmed a free-flowing South African innings, and sounded out a warning to teams around the world

image.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav celebrate a wicket
image.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav celebrate a wicket, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: Wise Kuldeep not scared to take his chances
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Wise Kuldeep Yadav not scared to take his chances
stories.summary: For a spinner in only his 15th ODI, the thought process Kuldeep showed was wise beyond the years, but it also takes a lot of guts to do that

image.caption: Kuldeep Yadav celebrates a wicket
image.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav celebrates a wicket, India v Sri Lanka, 2nd T20I, Indore, December 22, 2017

stories.title: Kohli completes a unique set of centuries
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Kohli completes a unique set of centuries
stories.summary: Kohli's 189-run third-wicket stand with Ajnikya Rahane was also the third-highest ODI stand for any wicket against South Africa

image.caption: Ajinkya Rahane plays a cut
image.longCaption: Ajinkya Rahane plays a cut, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: Kohli 112 bests du Plessis 120 as India go 1-0 up
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Kohli 112 bests du Plessis 120 as India go 1-0 up
stories.summary: A difficult chase of 270 ended up being straightforward thanks to a mighty Virat Kohli century and solid contribution from Ajinkya Rahane at No. 4

image.caption: Virat Kohli punches down the ground
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli punches down the ground, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: 'Rahane a strong candidate for No. 4' - Kohli
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: 'Rahane a strong candidate for No. 4' - Virat Kohli
stories.summary: On quicker pitches, in conditions similar to England where the 2019 World Cup will be played, Ajinkya Rahane can fit in to India's set-up as an opener or a middle-order batsman

image.caption: Ajinkya Rahane shapes to cut
image.longCaption: Ajinkya Rahane shapes to cut, India v Australia, 3rd ODI, Indore

stories.title: India sense ODI opportunity in de Villiers' absence
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: India sense ODI opportunity in AB de Villiers' absence
stories.summary: Despite having dominated much of the Tests, South Africa will have to contend with a confident ODI team, without their best player in the format

image.caption: A visual of the Durban pitch ahead of the first ODI
image.longCaption: A visual of the Durban pitch ahead of the first ODI, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, 31 January, 2017

videos.title: 'Scoring runs in a losing cause is not ideal' - du Plessis
videos.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
videos.seoTitle: 'Scoring runs in a losing cause is not ideal' - du Plessis
videos.summary: The South Africa captain also expects Imran Tahir to be among the wickets in the coming matches

videos.title: Manjrekar: India can be relied upon to win ODIs across the world
videos.subTitle: India in South Africa 2017-18
videos.seoTitle: Sanjay Manjrekar: India can be relied upon to win ODIs across the world
videos.summary: Sanjay Manjrekar and Ajit Agarkar pick their India XIs and discuss what chances the visitors have in the shorter formats in South Africa

galleries.title: Kohli rolling on the floor not laughing
galleries.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban

image.caption: Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis with the series trophy
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis with the series trophy, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: We needed 300, unfair to blame bowlers - du Plessis
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: We needed 300, unfair to blame bowlers - du Plessis
stories.summary: South Africa captain Faf du Plessis said that while the pitch offered assistance for the spinners, South Africa's batsmen needed to adapt better and string together partnerships

image.caption: Faf du Plessis raises the bat on reaching his hundred
image.longCaption: Faf du Plessis raises the bat on reaching his hundred, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: India's wristspinners announce themselves in the land of the wrong'un
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Monga: India's wristspinners announce themselves in the land of the wrong'un
stories.summary: Marrying magic with temperament, control with flair, Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav stemmed a free-flowing South African innings, and sounded out a warning to teams around the world

image.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav celebrate a wicket
image.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav celebrate a wicket, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: Wise Kuldeep not scared to take his chances
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Wise Kuldeep Yadav not scared to take his chances
stories.summary: For a spinner in only his 15th ODI, the thought process Kuldeep showed was wise beyond the years, but it also takes a lot of guts to do that

image.caption: Kuldeep Yadav celebrates a wicket
image.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav celebrates a wicket, India v Sri Lanka, 2nd T20I, Indore, December 22, 2017

stories.title: Kohli completes a unique set of centuries
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Kohli completes a unique set of centuries
stories.summary: Kohli's 189-run third-wicket stand with Ajnikya Rahane was also the third-highest ODI stand for any wicket against South Africa

image.caption: Ajinkya Rahane plays a cut
image.longCaption: Ajinkya Rahane plays a cut, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: Kohli 112 bests du Plessis 120 as India go 1-0 up
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Kohli 112 bests du Plessis 120 as India go 1-0 up
stories.summary: A difficult chase of 270 ended up being straightforward thanks to a mighty Virat Kohli century and solid contribution from Ajinkya Rahane at No. 4

image.caption: Virat Kohli punches down the ground
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli punches down the ground, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018
